intro: Praravinia robusta, commonly known as the robust praravinia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Praravinia robusta is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
